metadata.title: CVE-2019-12222 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in libSDL2.a in Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL) 2.0.9. There is an out-of-bounds read in the function SDL_InvalidateMap at video/SDL_pixels.c. USN-4238-1 addressed serveral vulnerabilities in SDL_image. This update provides the corresponding fixes for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-12222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.5+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.5+dfsg1-1').
sdl-image1.2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-11').
